description: Curated core references for antimicrobial discovery research

halicin.title: A Deep Learning Approach to Antibiotic Discovery
halicin.abstract: Using a deep neural network trained on 2335 compounds, screened 6111 compounds and discovered halicin, a structurally novel antibiotic with broad-spectrum activity including M. tuberculosis and pan-resistant A. baumannii.
halicin.key_findings: Halicin disrupts electrochemical gradient across bacterial membranes. Active against C. difficile, A. baumannii, M. tuberculosis. Low resistance evolution rate.

abaucin.title: Discovery of a structural class of antibiotics with explainable deep learning
abaucin.abstract: Used Chemprop with Monte Carlo tree search to discover abaucin, a narrow-spectrum antibiotic targeting A. baumannii with explainable substructure attribution.
abaucin.key_findings: Abaucin targets lipoprotein trafficking. Narrow-spectrum activity minimizes microbiome disruption. Explainable AI identifies key pharmacophore atoms.

amr_crisis.title: Antimicrobial resistance: a global emerging threat to public health systems
amr_crisis.abstract: Comprehensive review of the antimicrobial resistance crisis, documenting the decline in antibiotic R&D investment and the growing gap between resistance emergence and new drug approvals.
amr_crisis.key_findings: 18 pharma companies in 1980s vs 3 today. Only 4 drugs in pipeline target critical WHO pathogens. AMR projected to cause 10M deaths/year by 2050.

chemprop.title: Analyzing Learned Molecular Representations for Property Prediction
chemprop.journal: Journal of Chemical Information and Modeling
chemprop.abstract: Introduces Chemprop, a directed message-passing neural network (D-MPNN) that learns molecular representations directly from molecular graphs, outperforming fixed fingerprint methods on multiple benchmarks.
chemprop.key_findings: D-MPNN outperforms Morgan fingerprints + random forest on 19 of 22 benchmarks. Learns task-specific molecular features. Supports multi-task learning.

pkcsm.title: pkCSM: Predicting Small-Molecule Pharmacokinetic and Toxicity Properties Using Graph-Based Signatures
pkcsm.abstract: Graph-based signatures for predicting 30 ADMET properties including Caco-2 permeability, BBB penetration, CYP inhibition, hERG blocking, and hepatotoxicity.
pkcsm.key_findings: Free web server for ADMET prediction. Covers absorption, distribution, metabolism, excretion, and toxicity. Validated on curated datasets.

who_bppl_2024.title: WHO Bacterial Priority Pathogens List 2024
who_bppl_2024.abstract: Updated priority pathogen list for R&D of new antibiotics. MRSA remains critical priority. Lists 15 pathogen-antibiotic combinations requiring urgent new treatments.
who_bppl_2024.key_findings: MRSA, CRE, CRAB are critical priority. Only 12 innovative antibiotics in clinical pipeline. 4 target critical WHO pathogens.
